sen.j: 多田 基綱（ただ もとつな、生年未詳 - 承久3年6月（1221年））は、鎌倉時代初期の武将。
sen.e: Tomotsuna Tada (year of birth unknown - June 1221)was a 武将busho (Japanese military commander), who lived during the early Kamakura Period.

sen.j: 子に多田重綱（多田三郎）、親綱（修理亮）、行成らがある。
sen.e: His sons were Shigetsuna TADA (Saburo TADA), Chikatsuna (shuri no suke [assistant officer of the Office of Palace Repairs]), Yukinari, among others.

sen.j: 多田源氏の惣領であった父行綱は、源頼朝の粛清により累代の所領多田荘を奪われ没落。
sen.e: His father Yukitsuna was the heir of the Tada-Genji (Minamoto clan), but he was impoverished after his family's hereditary estate, Tada-no-sho, was confiscated during the political purge carried out by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 以降の行綱及びその子らの動向は不明となっている。
sen.e: Since then, no information had been available about Yukitsuna and his sons until 1221, when Retired Emperor Gotoba rose an army to overthrowing the Shogunate.

sen.j: が、承久3年（1221年）に後鳥羽上皇が倒幕の兵を挙げると基綱は上皇方として参加し、その敗北とともに討ち取られ梟首されたとの記録が残る（『吾妻鏡』同6月20日 (旧暦)条）。
sen.e: It is documented that Motosuna took part in the Retired Emperor's side, and when it was defeated, he was killed and his severed head was exposed (the article of June 20 of the third year of Shokyu era [old lunar calendar] in "Azuma Kagami" [The Mirror of the East]).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。 『吾妻鏡』同6月20日 (旧暦)条→定訳不明：the article of June 20 of the third year of Shokyu era (old lunar calendar) としました。
sen.e: However, it is documented that when the Retired Emperor Gotoba raised an army to overthrow the Shogunate, Mototsuna took part in the Retired Emperor's side, and that when it was defeated, he was killed and his severed head was exposed (the article of July 18, 1221 in "Azuma Kagami" [The Mirror of the East]).
sen.cmt: 原文と訳文の内容を一致させるため、分割し直しました。the Retired Emperorとし、rose an army to overthrowing→raised an army to overthrow、Motosuna→Mototsuna、旧暦表記→新暦に修正、一部訳文を修正
sen.e: However, it is documented that when the Retired Emperor Gotoba raised an army to overthrow the Shogunate, Mototsuna took part in the Retired Emperor's side, and that when it was defeated, he was killed and his severed head was exposed (the article of July 18, 1221 in "Azuma Kagami" [The Mirror of the East]).

sen.j: 上皇方への参加は多田荘の奪回を図ったものであろうと考えられている。
sen.e: It is considered that he participated in the Retired Emperor's side with the intention of recapturing Tada-no-sho estate.
It is considered that he participated in the Retired Emperor's side with the intention of recapturing Tada no sho estate.

sen.j: 子の重綱と親綱は甥の多田光綱が猶子とし、重綱の子孫が3代後まで存続していることが『尊卑分脈』に記されている。
sen.e: His sons, Shigetsuna and Chikatsuna were adopted by his nephew Mitsutsuna TADA, and according to "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy), Shigetsuna's descendent can be traiced down to the third generation later.
